posts.name: ZekiK
posts.cooked: Our PDH gives me a “Can Bus Off” sticky fault error which we can’t get rid of. The PDH is flashing Blue/Orange right now (After we somehow got rid of the whole PDH blinking red) My guess is that the CAN is wired wrong or probably a point is messed up. We also can’t see the sparkmax under the PDH however not one of the sparkmax show any errors by themselves and they work like they are supposed to.
Blue/Orange is low battery. What is the voltage reporting on the PDH ?

link_counts.title: Power Distribution Hub Status LED Patterns | REV Robotics Documentation

posts.name: ZekiK
posts.cooked: It’s seems quite normal, It’s between 11.6V-12.9V.

posts.name: Yuval Gur | Electronics & Software mentor
posts.cooked:
Make sure your PDH firmware is updated (via the USB-C connection, using the REV Hardware Client app).

Another thing worth checking is the CAN termination resistance — using a multimeter, check the resistance between the green (low) and yellow (high) ports on your PDH . You should see approximately 120 ohms.

Are you able to connect to the PDH via the CANbus network? Can you see other devices? This should help you determine whether the issue is with your CANbus or with the PDH itself.

posts.name: ZekiK
posts.cooked:
WhatsApp Görsel 2025-08-01 saat 13.31.29_e26ec101 1600×1204 180 KB

WhatsApp Görsel 2025-08-01 saat 13.31.29_e26ec101 1600×1204 180 KB

WhatsApp Görsel 2025-08-01 saat 13.31.29_e26ec101 1600×1204 180 KB

I downloaded the firmware however I can’t re-install it, it gives me an error saying it was unable to update it on the REV Hardware Client.

The PDH is fully red again and the CTR look underpowered and flicker green (is it normal looking so underpowered and flickering rather than it blinking?) My multimeter just broke so only after getting a new one can I measure the resistance.

I think I am able to connect to the CANbus network however I remember having some issues there aswell, it showed errors on most the Sparkmax’s when there was no error on them. (We are able to see the PDH ) However the network was also a bit unstable.

I’m now also getting the Hardware error from the CSA channel read. It gives me a Device over current led pattern when powered and hardware fault when I plug in the USB

UPDATE: The PDH only seems to be giving me a CAN Fault led pattern and a Can Bus Off Error on the REV Client

posts.name: Yuval Gur | Electronics & Software mentor
posts.cooked:
Do the SparkMAX controllers refuse to be updated (firmware) as well? Try different cable / pc anyway…

Are all of your PDH ports full with circuit breaker? - if not, make sure there isn’t some debris shortening it…

Are you able to try a different PDH pannel and connect itto the CAN network - just to confirm again if the problem is in the PDH or in the network

posts.name: ZekiK
posts.cooked: Big update, I took the PDH out and only connected 1 motor and Sparkmax to it and it actually works good now, I had a few error since the motor sensor cables were split but probably nothing important that can’t be fixed. So the issue is probably with the CAN Wiring all along the robot.

posts.name: Yuval Gur | Electronics & Software mentor
posts.cooked: Well… I guess the PDP is worth a try - I’ll also check the “broken” PDH - we just want to understand if the problem is with the CAN termination on the PDH or of the CAN network in general.

posts.name: ZekiK
posts.cooked:

I accidentally edited the reply before this, sorry bout that. Thanks for your help!!!

suggested_topics.title: Is it legal to use two PDP channels for one motor?
suggested_topics.excerpt: No. See R621. “Each branch circuit must be protected by 1 and only 1 circuit breaker or fuse”
